title: How to score 90% in class 10 (CBSE) if I scored very bad in the first term - Quora
tags: Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: First of all prepare a proper time table.Try to distribute equal amount of time to all your subjects every day.Never loose hope.Where there is a will there is a way.You have around 5 months left with yourself which is more than enough to score 90% in class 10 cbse. First pick up mathematics.Try to complete ncert textbook of mathematics in around 1 and a half months.Refer to the examples of RD Sharma class 10.I AGAIN REPEAT ONLY EXAMPLES. Next pick up Physics.Read the ncert textbook thoroughly.Refer to the examples of any of the refresher you prefer. Next pick up chemistry.Follow the same procedure as stated above. Put full concentration and study.This will help in grasping concepts faster. Keep around 20 days in hand to regularly practice the question papers(previous year).I would suggest you to buy previous year ques paper bank for effective study. Always stay motivated.Self motivation is an important factor that affect our thoughts and attitude positively during tough times. Study smartly,clear your doubts and stick to your timetable.This is the only mantra to score good marks in less time. Good Luck for ur exams……

No need to worry because your 1st term result will not added in your final results. In present cbse distributed 10th marks in two divisions one is based on assesment and other on your final board exam any term exam will not add in your final result your final board exam carry 80 marks and your assesment carry 20 marks. No need to worry for assesment because you will not get less than 18 marks in assesment you have to prepare only for final try to score more than 70 inall exams follow rd Sharma for maths schand for science. You will easily get 90% only you have to do smartwork all the best

Study thoroughly NCERT science ,rd Sharma maths,English,Hindi question banks,Social science oswal chapter wise. I referred Shivdas previous years solved papers for all 5. I scored easily 88 without much effort. I am last minute study kind of person. All the best.

How much time you have? Don't worry about the internal examination what you have done in past. Read (self study) eight hours minimum and try to cover your weak parts and revise daily allocate equal time to all the subject and extra time to those are weak. Best of luck for final Do your best

How can I study for CBSE board exam class 10? Ankit Kotnala, Instructor (2009-present.) Hi..Systematic study will help,Don't bother yourself much..1..Focus on ncert textbooks and it's solution.2.. get yourself any reference book.3.. go through last years question papers, it will help you to understand the format in which questions are asked.4.. set your aims and objectives..5.. keep testing yourself again and again. It will help you retain knowledge.
